Key 
Projects 

CDM Reporting for RBC: Period: Mar 2017-Till Date 

 
Technologies : Apache Spark, Scala, Hive, HDFS, NIFI, Oracle, SQL Server 

Description: The objective of the project is to bring banks operational data including 

Trades, Corporate actions, Events, Security details and various other sources to the Big 

Data platform as part of its next generation data management and to speed up the 

analytics over the data. Currently we are migrating data from oracle into HDFS and then 

transforming according to business requirements for Customer using spark and finally 

writing data back to SQL server to generate reports for the client. 

 
 
Responsibilities: 

• Ingestion: - Data was migrated from Oracle to HDFS using NIFI. Before data 
ingestion, materialized views (MVs & MV logs), Triggers and procedures are 
written on source table to migrate data into staging Data base and then from 
staging DB data is migrated to HDFS using NIFI. 

• Creating Hive tables to store the data ingested from the oracle. 

• Data Transformation- Generating events according to business logic/requirement 
using Spark and push the extracted data into SQL server. 

• Summarization- Finally in MS SQL, procedures and functions are written over the 
data to pass it further to client’s system called crystal to generate report. 

 

 
G2CV2 GEM Deployment for Citibank:                  Period: Aug 2016 - Feb 2017 

Technologies/Tools: Unix, Bladelogic BMC  

Description: G2CV2 is Global to common version 2. 15 countries were there for which 

we were maintaining the environment along with other teams, we were receiving 

deployment request in the form of Change request and Incident from ECC Team, build 

team used to create and fetch the build to us, after deployment we hand over it to 

testing team. Deployment was done by bladelogic which was preconfigured in which we 

used to follow certain steps to trigger deployment. Unix prompt was used to handle any 

issues post deployment like deployment not reflecting, server restarts. 

 

Responsibilities: 

• To deploy builds on the machines and keep the environment up and running. 

• Deployment  in the form of  Change Requests (CR) and Incident given by 

ECC Team. 

• Handling any glitches in deployment and provide fix within SLA. 

• Involved in server restarts when the environments are down. 

• Assisting team members in any deployment issues.
